        Suggested change

It would be better to throw exceptions early here instead of returning null. This "erases" information, going from a detailed failure, to a generic null state.
Same for other deserializers

sure sir
so we need this right? in TemporalDeserializers
I would suggest rethrowing as a JsonParseException, since that is something that consumers of this class will be expecting.
ok understand as its an exception because of wrong parsing

that's we want to throw JsonParseException?

and in all 3
No, you'll want to catch the IllegalArgumentException (not JsonParseException), and then throw a JsonParseException.  And yes, let's do that for all three.

I believe throws JsonParseException needs to stay here, since this method can still throw a JsonParseException?
Same for the other similar methods.
